result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A Kaiser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Daniel A Kaiser in court, in custody with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include $518.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  4 days credit.
